intro: Gonolobus cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of purple and blue. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other morning glories. It typically grows as a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, fragrant blooms. Gonolobus cubensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soil.
